reason: R2 connects the common source node (net07) to one output (VOUT1), providing local feedback / bias stabilization but not forming part of the essential signal path of the differential pair itself. If VB1 is chosen to bias M1 correctly, removing R2 still leaves a conventional differential pair with resistive loads R0 and R1, so the amplifier continues to function, albeit with somewhat changed gain and common-mode behavior.
impact_estimate: Lowâ€“moderate: main differential functionality and both outputs remain, but bias point, common-mode range, and linearity may shift; VB1 may need retuning.
